result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward J McGuire Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concur to 13CF1154.  Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
2/12/15: Court orders 275 days rather than 384 days of sentence credit on count 1.

superMiscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.

$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $278  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Psychiatric/psychological evaluation as deemed appropriate by agent and treatment as recommended.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with any victim & witness in 13CF1154 & 14CF782 (DDG & LDG).
Completion of aggression/anger management treatment.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

Information was filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defn waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of not guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued
Copy given defendant, reading waived.

Reporter: Linda Flakne
State's moves to orally correct errors in criminal complaint. No objection by the Defense.  Court grants oral amendments.  State calls Det. Folkers, duly sworn. Direct, cross. No further witnesses by either party.  State moves for bind over. Defense objects with argument. Rebuttal argument by the State. Court finds probable cause felony was commited. Binds case over.
Preliminary hearing on May 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with DDG and ALK
- Defendant shall not be on any Madison Metro Buses
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
  Defendant did not waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge - Br 12

Defendant in court with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Joseph E Mimier appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
